intro: Arthrosolen compactus, commonly known as the compact spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring shallow water or moist soil. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, clustered spikelets that contain tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Arthrosolen compactus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
